summary.narrativeincludeclinical: The patient is a middle-aged female with a chronic course and a 1-year medical history. She was admitted to the hospital via outpatient clinic with "dry mouth and eyes for 1 year and right temporomandibular joint pain for 1 week". Physical examination: no abnormal signs in the heart, lungs and abdomen. The physiological curvature of the spine existed, and forward flexion, back extension and lateral bending were available, the vertebrae and paravertebral muscles tenderness (-), bilateral straight leg raising test (-), sacroiliac joint tenderness (-), bilateral "4" test (-), left hand PIP2 and right hand PIP1 and 2 tenderness (+), left wrist joint swelling and tenderness (+), and bone rubbing sensation could be palpated in the left knee joint. There was no myalgia in the extremities, normal muscle strength and muscle tone, and no edema in both lower extremities. Bilateral babinski signs (-). Auxiliary examination: (April 17, 2023, in this hospital) blood routine examination: white blood cell count 5.60×10^9/L, neutrophil % 70.9%, hemoglobin 141g/L, platelet count 334×10^9/L, C-reactive protein <1.00mg/L, erythrocyte sedimentation rate 6mm/h. Blood biochemistry examination: total cholesterol 3.17mmol/L, Triglycerides 4.07mmol/L, HDL cholesterol 0.81mmol/L, the others were normal. Immunoglobulin A 3.16g/L, immunoglobulin G 15.67g/L, immunoglobulin M 1.26g/L. RF 20.85IU/mL, rheumatoid combination: U1-SnRNP positive (+), the rest negative. Antinuclear antibody positive (+) 1:1000 granular type. Salivary flow rate + three eye tests: salivary flow rate basal 0ml/min, 0.5ml/min after stimulation, tear secretion test: left was 16mm/5min, right was 16mm/5min, break-up time of tear film: left > 10 seconds, right > 10 seconds, bilateral corneal staining were (-). Ultrasound of both hands: no significant abnormalities were seen in both hands. After treatment with Anethol Trithione Tablets, diarrhea developed outside the hospital.
